intro: Pharmacum parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pharmacum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its potential pharmacological properties, it has been the subject of some botanical and ethnobotanical studies.
